functional programming
data structures
object-oriented programming
record type
tuple
value semantics
read-only
const correctness
immutability
persistence

Note: Immutable records are a type of data structure commonly used in functional programming, which cannot be modified once created. They are often compared to tuples and offer value semantics, providing benefits such as read-only access, const correctness, and persistence. Immutable records can be found in object-oriented programming as well, offering an alternative to traditional mutable objects.
